New Records: The Yankees clinched their 32nd straight winning season, the second-longest such period in major league history, trailing a run of 39 consecutive seasons for the Yankees from 1926-64.
Key Match Events: Clarke Schmidt pitched 4 2/3 innings of four-hit ball in his first big league game since May 26
Nestor Cortes (9-10) closed it out in his first relief appearance since 2021
Austin Wells drove in Gleyber Torres with a groundout in the first
Aaron Judge swiped third as part of a double steal and scampered home on catcher Christian Bethancourtâ€™s throwing error
Pre-Game Insights: The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance, but there are no direct quotes from the article
The Yankees were trying to move back into first in the AL East, coupled with Baltimore's 7-1 loss to Tampa Bay.
Post-Match Reflections: Cortes admitted he was upset when he learned he was going to pitch in relief, but he came out and proved he can be put in any situation
Schmidt had been sidelined by a right lat strain, but he felt like he still had a lot of strength and wasn't fatiguing at all
The Cubs had their best scoring opportunity in the fifth, but were stranded when Cortes got Bethancourt to foul out
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Wrigley Field in front of 40,080 fans
The Yankees first baseman Anthony Rizzo heard more cheers in his second game back at Wrigley Field since he was traded by Chicago to New York in July 2021
The Cubs right-hander Javier Assad (7-5) allowed one earned run and three hits in 5 2/3 innings
Others: The Cubs have lost four of five on a crucial homestand as it tries to rally in the race for the third NL wild card
The Yankees lead the Orioles by a half-game in the AL East
